intro: Acmella occidentalis, commonly known as the "sensitive plant" or "touch-me-not," is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers and distinctive leaves that fold when touched. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory properties. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil conditions make it a popular choice for gardeners. However, it is important to note that the plant can become invasive in certain environments if not managed properly.
